project.teaser: RESILIAGE’s mission is to provide novel knowledge and impactful solutions for exploiting Europe´s hidden and unused resource: community resilience. RESILIAGE will enable a step-change in Disaster Risk Management and in the way research and practice deal with variation in...
project.objective:
RESILIAGE’s mission is to provide novel knowledge and impactful solutions for exploiting Europe´s hidden and unused resource: community resilience. RESILIAGE will enable a step-change in Disaster Risk Management and in the way research and practice deal with variation in aspects of society like culture, risk awareness, inclusion, socio-economic and geographical conditions by co-creating resilient communities through digital tools and soft solutions consolidated in a holistic and systemic approach.
RESILIAGE aims to improve understanding of the behaviour and psychological reactions of diverse society groups affected by a natural and man-made disaster and enhance community resilience. Indeed, with the proactive and participatory involvement of all the relevant stakeholders and end users, RESILIAGE will co-shape and develop a set of digital tools and soft solutions to support first responders and public authorities, empower citizens, share more accurate and accessible information prior, during and after a natural and man-made disaster or crisis situation. These will be integrated in a digital platform, the Resource Ecosystem for Community Resilience, and validated through a holistic systemic Disaster Risk Management and multi-hazards approach in five Community Resilience labs and their networks. Results and lessons learned will provide guidelines and policy recommendations to enhance preparedness plans, SENDAI framework and strategies for Climate Change Adaptation.
project.title: Advancing holistic understanding of community RESILIence and heritAGE drivers through community-based methodologies
project.keywords: Large-scale exercises, Cultural aspects, Data-driven platform

article.title: Digital tools and heritage drivers for community resilience in Europe

category.title: Simulation for decision making (real time simulation)
Ensure collective protection (included secure public area)

result.title: Indicators for Systemic Community Resilience Assessment and Monitoring
result.description: D2.3 will encompass all relevant indicators for crisis behaviour modelled in order to monitor community resilience and strategies for PPs.

result.title: Report on risk adaptation, risk awareness & threat reaction
result.description: D2.2 will include all experimental and simulation results from T2.3/4 on the temporal dimension of risk perception and adaptation, psychological effects post-disaster, changes of risk perception through awareness raising, and reactions to imminent threats.

result.title: Scoping review of socio-behavioural factors in crises and disasters
result.description: D1.2 will explore socio-behavioural international literature on human factors of crises and disasters mapping the cascading effects of individual and collective responses to crises incl. needs of vulnerable groups.

result.title: Needs analysis and training requirements definition
result.description: D4.1 will report a synthesis of the needs and gaps analysis conducted in T4.1.

result.title: Ethical guidance of RESILIAGE
result.description: D8.3 will report the project ethical guidance.

result.title: Projects to Policy Seminar 2024 - CERIS Community for European Research and Innovation for Security

details.publisher: CERIS Community for European Research and Innovation for Security

result.title: Repository of International Standards & Inventory of Lessons Learned of Disaster Management Preparedness
result.description: D1.1 will encompass international standards and best practices for disaster management and sustainable development for the 5 crisis scenarios focussing on societal resilience.

result.title: CORE survey: Gap analysis and Inventory of RESILIAGE Lessons Learned
result.description: D2.1 will investigate the 5 COREs and produce a gap analysis on policy implementation, organisational make up, knowledge, training and identify LL, local best practices as well as investigate past crises via social media.

result.title: RESOURCES ECOSYSTEM for Community Resilience. First Release + documentationtion
result.description: D3.1 will provide the RESILIAGE Resource Ecosystem platform and the integration of digital tools. This is accompanied by documentation

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - RESILIAGE (Advancing holistic understanding of community RESILIence and heritAGE drivers through community-based methodologies)
result.teaser: RESILIAGE’s mission is to provide novel knowledge and impactful solutions for exploiting Europe´s hidden and unused resource: community resilience. Its overall goal is to prevent and mitigate the effects of disasters and climate change-related events by enabling critical...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Data lake model
result.description: D1.3 will serve as centralised repository for the storage, use, and re-use of structured and unstructured data, defining technical requirements, and developing a common glossary.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
